translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Thomaka
“The Awakened One, the One of Broad Wisdom,
was staying at the foot of a tree;
I gave it to the Unconquered One.

analyzed: ekanavutitaḥ kappe  yam paṇṇa kuṭikam ada

translated: I do not recall any bad destination,🔽this is the fruit of giving a leaf-hut.
were said to have been Universal Monarchs.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kuṭidāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā kuṭidāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Kuṭidāyaka recited these verses.
The Elder Kuṭidāyaka’s Birth Story, the ninth.
